Eclipse Logging
The org.eclipse.e4.core.services plug-in contains the Logger class which can get injected via dependency injection. The default implementation is provided by the WorkbenchLogger class.
The Logger implementation wraps the IStatus into an simpler interface and provides several methods to log info, warning or error message. The following code shows example calls.
Customers can replace the WorkbenchLogger implementation in the Context with there own implementation. For example this way customers could log to the Eclipse system as well as to other external log systems.
The log level can be setup in the config.ini file of your application via the eclipse.log.level parameter. The value can be set to INFO , WARNING and ERROR . INFO will for example show all log message.
By default Eclipse logs all messages.
